ЁЯСС
Successors of the Shungas

The Kanva dynasty was an ancient Brahmanical dynasty that ruled Magadha after the decline of the Shunga Empire. It was founded by Vasudeva Kanva in 73 BCE by assassinating the last Shunga king Devabhuti. Although their reign was short, they kept alive the traditions and Vedic culture of Magadha.

ЁЯУЙ
Shrinking Empire

By the time of the Kanvas, the power of the Magadha empire had significantly diminished. Their direct control was primarily limited to Pataliputra and its surrounding areas (Bihar, Eastern Uttar Pradesh). Punjab and the Northwest were already under the sway of the Greeks and Shakas, and the Satavahanas in the Deccan were rapidly gaining power.

ЁЯУЬ
Sources

The main sources of information about this dynasty are the Puranas (Vishnu, Vayu, Matsya) and Bana's 'Harshacharita'. Coinage evidence is very limited, indicating their declining economic and political strength.
